data.text: How Important Is It to Balance the Weight in Panniers?
Hi , Just starting to get my kit together. How important is it to ballance the weight in panniers ? Cheers mark
Just got the left to right balance close it's not that big a deal and it's more important in the front than in the back
data.author: Steve Shea

data.text: I like to balance the panniers from left to right, then I try to get a "weight/heaviness" equality on front and rear wheel when loaded with me too. It sounds crazy. but I use my bathroom scale and a block equal to the height of that scale. I only use front panniers and a handlebar bag, and other stuff sits on top of my rear rack. I also use three water bottles mounted on the seat tube and down tube.

data.text: Left to right more important in the front because otherwise you can get significant wheel wobble. You want the center of gravity to be as low as possible (heavy stuff in the bottom). Better to have more weight in the back than front.

data.text: It's not hugely important. I tend to think of each rear pannier as a room or similar - left kitchen and bedroom (cooking stuff and sleep system), right is wardrobe and bathroom (clothes and toiletries). Frame bag is always spares and tools, bar bag for electronics, documents and valuables. Tent goes on top of the rack. With that distribution, the two panniers come within half a kg of each other in weight.
